parameters.name: startupType
parameters.desc: TPM_SU_CLEAR or TPM_SU_STATE

Shutdown.name: TPM2_Shutdown
Shutdown.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: shutdownType
parameters.desc: TPM_SU_CLEAR or TPM_SU_STATE

SelfTest.name: TPM2_SelfTest
SelfTest.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: fullTest
parameters.desc: YES if full test to be performed  NO if only test of untested functions required

IncrementalSelfTest.name: TPM2_IncrementalSelfTest
IncrementalSelfTest.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: toTest
parameters.desc: list of algorithms that should be tested

parameters.name: toDoList
parameters.desc: list of algorithms that need testing

GetTestResult.name: TPM2_GetTestResult
GetTestResult.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or encrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: outData
parameters.desc: test result data  contains manufacturer-specific information

parameters.name: testResult
parameters.desc: the result of a test started via TPM2_SelfTest()  TPM_RC_NEEDS_TEST if a test has not yet been run  TPM_RC_TESTING if a test is currently running

StartAuthSession.name: TPM2_StartAuthSession
StartAuthSession.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit, encrypt, or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: tpmKey
handles.desc: handle of a loaded decrypt key used to encrypt *salt*  ::: Deprecated ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: It is deprecated to allow *tpmKey* to be an unrestricted key. See Part 0. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::  may be TPM_RH_NULL

handles.name: bind
handles.desc: entity providing the *authValue*  may be TPM_RH_NULL

parameters.name: nonceCaller
parameters.desc: initial *nonceCaller,* sets nonceTPM size for the session  shall be at least 16 octets

parameters.name: encryptedSalt
parameters.desc: value encrypted according to the type of *tpmKey*  If *tpmKey* is TPM_RH_NULL, this shall be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: sessionType
parameters.desc: indicates the type of the session; simple HMAC or policy (including a trial policy)

parameters.name: symmetric
parameters.desc: the algorithm and key size for parameter encryption  may select TPM_ALG_NULL

parameters.name: authHash
parameters.desc: hash algorithm to use for the session  Shall be a hash algorithm supported by the TPM and not TPM_ALG_NULL

handles.name: sessionHandle
handles.desc: handle for the newly created session

parameters.name: nonceTPM
parameters.desc: the initial nonce from the TPM, used in the computation of the *sessionKey*

PolicyRestart.name: TPM2_PolicyRestart
PolicyRestart.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: sessionHandle
handles.desc: the handle for the policy session

handles.name: parentHandle
handles.desc: handle of parent for new object

parameters.name: inSensitive
parameters.desc: the sensitive data

parameters.name: inPublic
parameters.desc: the public template

parameters.name: outsideInfo
parameters.desc: data that will be included in the creation data for this object to provide permanent, verifiable linkage between this object and some object owner data

parameters.name: creationPCR
parameters.desc: PCR that will be used in creation data

parameters.name: outPrivate
parameters.desc: the private portion of the object

parameters.name: outPublic
parameters.desc: the public portion of the created object

parameters.name: creationData
parameters.desc: contains a TPMS_CREATION_DATA

parameters.name: creationHash
parameters.desc: digest of *creationData.creationData* using *nameAlg* of *outPublic*

parameters.name: creationTicket
parameters.desc: ticket used by TPM2_CertifyCreation() to validate that the creation data was produced by the TPM

handles.name: parentHandle
handles.desc: TPM handle of parent key; shall not be a reserved handle

parameters.name: inPrivate
parameters.desc: the private portion of the object

parameters.name: inPublic
parameters.desc: the public portion of the object

handles.name: objectHandle
handles.desc: handle of type TPM_HT_TRANSIENT for the loaded object

parameters.name: name
parameters.desc: Name of the loaded object

LoadExternal.name: TPM2_LoadExternal
LoadExternal.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit, encrypt, or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: inPrivate
parameters.desc: the sensitive portion of the object (optional)

parameters.name: inPublic
parameters.desc: the public portion of the object

parameters.name: hierarchy
parameters.desc: hierarchy with which the object area is associated

handles.name: objectHandle
handles.desc: handle of type TPM_HT_TRANSIENT for the loaded object

parameters.name: name
parameters.desc: Name of the loaded object

ReadPublic.name: TPM2_ReadPublic
ReadPublic.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or encrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: objectHandle
handles.desc: TPM handle of an object

parameters.name: outPublic
parameters.desc: structure containing the public area of an object

parameters.name: name
parameters.desc: Name of the object

parameters.name: qualifiedName
parameters.desc: the Qualified Name of the object

handles.name: activateHandle
handles.desc: handle of the object associated with certificate in *credentialBlob*

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: loaded key used to decrypt the TPMS_SENSITIVE in *credentialBlob*

parameters.name: credentialBlob
parameters.desc: the credential

parameters.name: secret
parameters.desc: *keyHandle* algorithm-dependent encrypted seed that protects *credentialBlob*

parameters.name: certInfo
parameters.desc: the decrypted information  the data should be no larger than the size of the digest of the *nameAlg* associated with *keyHandle*

MakeCredential.name: TPM2_MakeCredential
MakeCredential.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit, encrypt, or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: handle
handles.desc: loaded public area, used to encrypt the sensitive area containing the credential key

parameters.name: credential
parameters.desc: the credential information

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.desc: Name of the object to which the credential applies

parameters.name: credentialBlob
parameters.desc: the credential

parameters.name: secret
parameters.desc: *handle* algorithm-dependent data that wraps the key that encrypts *credentialBlob*

handles.name: itemHandle
handles.desc: handle of a loaded data object

parameters.name: outData
parameters.desc: unsealed data  Size of *outData* is limited to be no more than 128 octets.

handles.name: objectHandle
handles.desc: handle of the object

handles.name: parentHandle
handles.desc: handle of the parent

parameters.name: newAuth
parameters.desc: new authorization value

parameters.name: outPrivate
parameters.desc: private area containing the new authorization value

handles.name: parentHandle
handles.desc: Handle of a transient storage key, a persistent storage key, TPM_RH_ENDORSEMENT, TPM_RH_OWNER, TPM_RH_PLATFORM+{PP}, or TPM_RH_NULL

parameters.name: inSensitive
parameters.desc: the sensitive data, see TPM 2.0 Part 1 Sensitive Values

parameters.name: inPublic
parameters.desc: the public template

handles.name: objectHandle
handles.desc: handle of type TPM_HT_TRANSIENT for created object

parameters.name: outPrivate
parameters.desc: the sensitive area of the object (optional)

parameters.name: outPublic
parameters.desc: the public portion of the created object

parameters.name: name
parameters.desc: the Name of the created object

handles.name: objectHandle
handles.desc: loaded object to duplicate

handles.name: newParentHandle
handles.desc: shall reference the public area of an asymmetric key

parameters.name: encryptionKeyIn
parameters.desc: optional symmetric encryption key  The size for this key is set to zero when the TPM is to generate the key. This parameter may be encrypted.

parameters.name: symmetricAlg
parameters.desc: definition for the symmetric algorithm to be used for the inner wrapper  may be TPM_ALG_NULL if no inner wrapper is applied

parameters.name: encryptionKeyOut
parameters.desc: If the caller provided an encryption key or if *symmetricAlg* was TPM_ALG_NULL, then this will be the Empty Buffer; otherwise, it shall contain the TPM- generated, symmetric encryption key for the inner wrapper.

parameters.name: duplicate
parameters.desc: private area that may be encrypted by *encryptionKeyIn*; and may be doubly encrypted

parameters.name: outSymSeed
parameters.desc: seed protected by the asymmetric algorithms of new parent (NP)

handles.name: oldParent
handles.desc: parent of object

handles.name: newParent
handles.desc: new parent of the object

parameters.name: inDuplicate
parameters.desc: an object encrypted using symmetric key derived from *inSymSeed*

parameters.name: name
parameters.desc: the Name of the object being rewrapped

parameters.name: inSymSeed
parameters.desc: the seed for the symmetric key and HMAC key  needs *oldParent* private key to recover the seed and generate the symmetric key

parameters.name: outDuplicate
parameters.desc: an object encrypted using symmetric key derived from *outSymSeed*

parameters.name: outSymSeed
parameters.desc: seed for a symmetric key protected by *newParent* asymmetric key

handles.name: parentHandle
handles.desc: the handle of the new parent for the object

parameters.name: encryptionKey
parameters.desc: the optional symmetric encryption key used as the inner wrapper for *duplicate*  If *symmetricAlg* is TPM_ALG_NULL, then this parameter shall be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: objectPublic
parameters.desc: the public area of the object to be imported  This is provided so that the integrity value for *duplicate* and the object attributes can be checked.  NOTE Even if the integrity value of the object is not checked on input, the object Name is required to create the integrity value for the imported object.

parameters.name: duplicate
parameters.desc: the symmetrically encrypted duplicate object that may contain an inner symmetric wrapper

parameters.name: inSymSeed
parameters.desc: the seed for the symmetric key and HMAC key  *inSymSeed* is encrypted/encoded using the algorithms of *newParent*.

parameters.name: symmetricAlg
parameters.desc: definition for the symmetric algorithm to use for the inner wrapper  If this algorithm is TPM_ALG_NULL, no inner wrapper is present and *encryptionKey* shall be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: outPrivate
parameters.desc: the sensitive area encrypted with the symmetric key of *parentHandle*

RSA_Encrypt.name: TPM2_RSA_Encrypt
RSA_Encrypt.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit, encrypt, or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: reference to public portion of RSA key to use for encryption

parameters.name: message
parameters.desc: message to be encrypted  NOTE The data type was chosen because it limits the overall size of the input to no greater than the size of the largest RSA public key. This may be larger than allowed for *keyHandle*.

parameters.name: inScheme
parameters.desc: the padding scheme to use if *scheme* associated with *keyHandle* is TPM_ALG_NULL

parameters.name: label
parameters.desc: optional label *L* to be associated with the message  Size of the buffer is zero if no label is present  NOTE See the description of *label* above.

parameters.name: outData
parameters.desc: encrypted output

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: RSA key to use for decryption

parameters.name: cipherText
parameters.desc: cipher text to be decrypted  NOTE An encrypted RSA data block is the size of the public modulus.

parameters.name: inScheme
parameters.desc: the padding scheme to use if *scheme* associated with *keyHandle* is TPM_ALG_NULL

parameters.name: label
parameters.desc: label whose association with the message is to be verified

parameters.name: message
parameters.desc: decrypted output

ECDH_KeyGen.name: TPM2_ECDH_KeyGen
ECDH_KeyGen.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or encrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: Handle of a loaded ECC key public area.

parameters.name: zPoint
parameters.desc: results of $P ≔ h[d_e]Q_s$

parameters.name: pubPoint
parameters.desc: generated ephemeral public point ($Q_e$)

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: handle of a loaded ECC key

parameters.name: inPoint
parameters.desc: a public key

parameters.name: outPoint
parameters.desc: X and Y coordinates of the product of the multiplication $Z = (x_Z, y_Z) ≔ h[d_s]Q_B$

ECC_Parameters.name: TPM2_ECC_Parameters
ECC_Parameters.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: curveID
parameters.desc: parameter set selector

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.desc: ECC parameters for the selected curve

handles.name: keyA
handles.desc: handle of an unrestricted ECC decryption key  The private key referenced by this handle is used as $d_{s,A}$

parameters.name: inQsB
parameters.desc: other party's static public key ($Q_{s,B} = (X_{s,B}, Y_{s,B})$)

parameters.name: inQeB
parameters.desc: other party's ephemeral public key ($Q_{e,B} = (X_{e,B}, Y_{e,B})$)

parameters.name: inScheme
parameters.desc: the key exchange scheme

parameters.name: counter
parameters.desc: value returned by TPM2_EC_Ephemeral()

parameters.name: outZ1
parameters.desc: X and Y coordinates of the computed value (scheme dependent)

parameters.name: outZ2
parameters.desc: X and Y coordinates of the second computed value (scheme dependent)

ECC_Encrypt.name: TPM2_ECC_Encrypt
ECC_Encrypt.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit, encrypt, or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: reference to the public portion of ECC key to use for encryption

parameters.name: plainText
parameters.desc: Plaintext to be encrypted

parameters.name: inScheme
parameters.desc: the KDF to use if *scheme* associated with *keyHandle* is TPM_ALG_NULL

parameters.name: C1
parameters.desc: the public ephemeral key used for ECDH

parameters.name: C2
parameters.desc: the data block produced by the XOR process

parameters.name: C3
parameters.desc: the integrity value

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: ECC key to use for decryption

parameters.name: C1
parameters.desc: the public ephemeral key used for ECDH

parameters.name: C2
parameters.desc: the data block produced by the XOR process

parameters.name: C3
parameters.desc: the integrity value

parameters.name: inScheme
parameters.desc: the KDF to use if *scheme* associated with *keyHandle* is TPM_ALG_NULL

parameters.name: plainText
parameters.desc: decrypted output

Encapsulate.name: TPM2_Encapsulate
Encapsulate.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or encrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: reference to public portion of KEM key to use for encapsulation

parameters.name: sharedSecret
parameters.desc: random secret shared between both parties

parameters.name: ciphertext
parameters.desc: encapsulated ciphertext that can be decapsulated with the private key to produce *sharedSecret*

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: reference to loaded KEM key to use for decapsulation

parameters.name: ciphertext
parameters.desc: encapsulated ciphertext

parameters.name: sharedSecret
parameters.desc: decapsulated shared secret

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: the symmetric key used for the operation

parameters.name: decrypt
parameters.desc: if YES, then the operation is decryption; if NO, the operation is encryption

parameters.name: mode
parameters.desc: symmetric encryption/decryption mode  this field shall match the default mode of the key or be TPM_ALG_NULL.

parameters.name: ivIn
parameters.desc: an initial value as required by the algorithm

parameters.name: inData
parameters.desc: the data to be encrypted/decrypted

parameters.name: outData
parameters.desc: encrypted or decrypted output

parameters.name: ivOut
parameters.desc: chaining value to use for IV in next round

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: the symmetric key used for the operation

parameters.name: inData
parameters.desc: the data to be encrypted/decrypted

parameters.name: decrypt
parameters.desc: if YES, then the operation is decryption; if NO, the operation is encryption

parameters.name: mode
parameters.desc: symmetric mode  this field shall match the default mode of the key or be TPM_ALG_NULL.

parameters.name: ivIn
parameters.desc: an initial value as required by the algorithm

parameters.name: outData
parameters.desc: encrypted or decrypted output

parameters.name: ivOut
parameters.desc: chaining value to use for IV in next round

Hash.name: TPM2_Hash
Hash.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit, encrypt, or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: data
parameters.desc: data to be hashed

parameters.name: hashAlg
parameters.desc: algorithm for the hash being computed - shall not be TPM_ALG_NULL

parameters.name: hierarchy
parameters.desc: hierarchy to use for the ticket

parameters.name: outHash
parameters.desc: results

parameters.name: validation
parameters.desc: ticket indicating that the sequence of octets used to compute *outHash* did not start with TPM_GENERATED_VALUE  will be a NULL ticket if the digest may not be signed with a restricted key

handles.name: handle

parameters.name: outHMAC
parameters.desc: the returned HMAC in a sized buffer

handles.name: handle

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.desc: MAC data

parameters.name: inScheme
parameters.desc: algorithm to use for MAC

parameters.name: outMAC
parameters.desc: the returned MAC in a sized buffer

GetRandom.name: TPM2_GetRandom
GetRandom.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or encrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

SignVerifySequenceStart.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: results

parameters.desc: the signature over *certifyInfo*

parameters.name: quoted

parameters.name: signature

handles.name: privacyAdminHandle

handles.name: signHandle
handles.desc: the *keyHandle* identifier of a loaded key that can perform digital signatures

parameters.desc: data to tick stamp

parameters.name: inScheme

parameters.name: timeInfo
parameters.desc: standard TPM-generated attestation block

parameters.name: signature
parameters.desc: the signature over *timeInfo*

handles.name: objectHandle
handles.desc: handle of the object to be certified

handles.name: signHandle
handles.desc: handle of the key used to sign the attestation structure

parameters.name: reserved
parameters.desc: shall be an Empty Buffer

parameters.name: inScheme
parameters.desc: signing scheme to use if the *scheme* for *signHandle* is TPM_ALG_NULL

parameters.name: partialCertificate
parameters.desc: a DER encoded partial certificate

parameters.name: addedToCertificate
parameters.desc: a DER encoded SEQUENCE containing the DER encoded fields added to partialCertificate to make it a complete RFC 5280 TBSCertificate.

parameters.name: tbsDigest
parameters.desc: the digest that was signed

parameters.name: signature
parameters.desc: The signature over *tbsDigest*

handles.name: signHandle
handles.desc: handle of the key that will be used in the signing operation

parameters.name: P1
parameters.desc: a point (*M*) on the curve used by *signHandle*

parameters.name: s2
parameters.desc: octet array used to derive x-coordinate of a base point

parameters.name: y2
parameters.desc: y coordinate of the point associated with *s2*

parameters.name: K
parameters.desc: ECC point *K* ≔ \[*ds*\]*(x2, y2)*

parameters.name: L
parameters.desc: ECC point *L* ≔ \[*r*\]*(x2, y2)*

parameters.name: E
parameters.desc: ECC point *E* ≔ \[*r*\]*P1*

parameters.name: counter
parameters.desc: least-significant 16 bits of *commitCount*

EC_Ephemeral.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or encrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: Q
parameters.desc: ephemeral public key *Q* ≔ \[*r*\]*G*

parameters.name: counter

VerifySignature.name: TPM2_VerifySignature
VerifySignature.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

VerifyDigestSignature.name: TPM2_VerifyDigestSignature
VerifyDigestSignature.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: inScheme
parameters.desc: signing scheme to use if the *scheme* for *keyHandle* is TPM_ALG_NULL

parameters.name: validation
parameters.desc: proof that digest was created by the TPM  If *keyHandle* is not a restricted signing key, then this may be a NULL Ticket with *tag* = TPM_ST_HASHCHECK.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.desc: the signature

handles.name: sequenceHandle
handles.desc: authorization for the sequence

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: Handle of key that will perform signing

parameters.name: buffer
parameters.desc: data to be added to the signature

parameters.name: signature
parameters.desc: the signature

handles.name: keyHandle
handles.desc: Handle of key that will perform signing

parameters.name: context
parameters.desc: additional context (requires a supporting signing scheme)  depending on the scheme, *context* may be optional, i.e., zero-length.

parameters.name: digest
parameters.desc: digest to be signed

parameters.name: validation
parameters.desc: proof that digest was created by the TPM  If *keyHandle* is not a restricted signing key, then this may be a NULL Ticket with *tag* = TPM_ST_HASHCHECK.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.desc: the signature

handles.name: auth
handles.desc: TPM_RH_OWNER or TPM_RH_PLATFORM+{PP}

parameters.name: auditAlg
parameters.desc: hash algorithm for the audit digest; if TPM_ALG_NULL, then the hash is not changed

parameters.name: setList
parameters.desc: list of commands that will be added to those that will be audited

parameters.name: clearList
parameters.desc: list of commands that will no longer be audited

handles.name: pcrHandle
handles.desc: handle of the PCR

parameters.name: digests
parameters.desc: list of tagged digest values to be extended

handles.name: pcrHandle
handles.desc: Handle of the PCR

parameters.name: eventData
parameters.desc: Event data in sized buffer

parameters.name: digests
parameters.desc: hash of *eventData* using all hashes for *pcrHandle*

PCR_Read.name: TPM2_PCR_Read
PCR_Read.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

parameters.name: pcrSelectionIn
parameters.desc: The selection of PCR to read

parameters.name: pcrUpdateCounter
parameters.desc: the current value of the PCR update counter

parameters.name: pcrSelectionOut
parameters.desc: the PCR in the returned list

parameters.name: pcrValues
parameters.desc: the contents of the PCR indicated in *pcrSelectOut→ pcrSelection[]* as tagged digests

handles.name: authHandle
handles.desc: TPM_RH_PLATFORM+{PP}

parameters.name: pcrAllocation
parameters.desc: the requested allocation

parameters.name: allocationSuccess
parameters.desc: YES if the allocation succeeded

parameters.name: maxPCR
parameters.desc: maximum number of PCR that may be in a bank

parameters.name: sizeNeeded
parameters.desc: number of octets required to satisfy the request

parameters.name: sizeAvailable
parameters.desc: Number of octets available. Computed before the allocation.

handles.name: authHandle
handles.desc: TPM_RH_PLATFORM+{PP}

parameters.name: authPolicy
parameters.desc: the desired *authPolicy*

parameters.name: hashAlg
parameters.desc: the hash algorithm of the policy

parameters.name: pcrNum
parameters.desc: the PCR for which the policy is to be set

handles.name: pcrHandle
handles.desc: handle for a PCR that may have an authorization value set

parameters.name: auth
parameters.desc: the desired authorization value

handles.name: pcrHandle
handles.desc: the PCR to reset

PolicySigned.name: TPM2_PolicySigned
PolicySigned.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit, encrypt, or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: authObject
handles.desc: handle for a key that will validate the signature

handles.name: policySession
handles.desc: handle for the policy session being extended

parameters.name: nonceTPM
parameters.desc: the policy nonce for the session  This can be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: cpHashA
parameters.desc: digest of the command parameters to which this authorization is limited  This is not the *cpHash* for this command but the *cpHash* for the command to which this policy session will be applied. If it is not limited, the parameter will be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: policyRef
parameters.desc: a reference to a policy relating to the authorization - may be the Empty Buffer  Size is limited to be no larger than the nonce size supported on the TPM.

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.desc: time when authorization will expire, measured in seconds from the time that *nonceTPM* was generated  If *expiration* is non-negative, a NULL Ticket is returned (see @sec:policy-ticket-creation).

parameters.name: auth
parameters.desc: signed authorization (not optional)

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.desc: implementation-specific time value used to indicate to the TPM when the ticket expires  If *policyTicket* is a NULL Ticket, then this shall be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: policyTicket
parameters.desc: produced if the command succeeds and *expiration* in the command was negative; this ticket will use the TPM_ST_AUTH_SIGNED structure tag (see @sec:policy-ticket-creation).

handles.name: authHandle
handles.desc: handle for an entity providing the authorization

handles.name: policySession
handles.desc: handle for the policy session being extended

parameters.name: nonceTPM
parameters.desc: the policy nonce for the session  This can be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: cpHashA
parameters.desc: digest of the command parameters to which this authorization is limited  This is not the *cpHash* for this command but the *cpHash* for the command to which this policy session will be applied. If it is not limited, the parameter will be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: policyRef
parameters.desc: a reference to a policy relating to the authorization - may be the Empty Buffer  Size is limited to be no larger than the nonce size supported on the TPM.

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.desc: time when authorization will expire, measured in seconds from the time that *nonceTPM* was generated  If *expiration* is non-negative, a NULL Ticket is returned (see @sec:policy-ticket-creation).

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.desc: implementation-specific time value used to indicate to the TPM when the ticket expires  If *policyTicket* is a NULL Ticket, then this shall be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: policyTicket
parameters.desc: produced if the command succeeds and *expiration* in the command was negative; this ticket will use the TPM_ST_AUTH_SECRET structure tag (see @sec:policy-ticket-creation).

PolicyTicket.name: TPM2_PolicyTicket
PolicyTicket.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: policySession
handles.desc: handle for the policy session being extended

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.desc: time when authorization will expire  The contents are TPM specific. This shall be the value returned when ticket was produced.

parameters.name: cpHashA
parameters.desc: digest of the command parameters to which this authorization is limited  If it is not limited, the parameter will be the Empty Buffer.

parameters.name: policyRef
parameters.desc: reference to a qualifier for the policy - may be the Empty Buffer

parameters.name: authName
parameters.desc: Name of the object that provided the authorization

parameters.name: ticket
parameters.desc: an authorization ticket returned by the TPM in response to a TPM2_PolicySigned() or TPM2_PolicySecret()

parameters.name: newMaxTries

parameters.name: newRecoveryTime
parameters.desc: time in seconds before the authorization failure count is automatically decremented  A value of zero indicates that DA protection is disabled.

parameters.name: lockoutRecovery
parameters.desc: time in seconds after a *lockoutAuth* failure before use of *lockoutAuth* is allowed  A value of zero indicates that a reboot is required.

parameters.desc: list of capabilities

handles.name: sendObject
handles.desc: handle of the object being sent to ac

handles.name: authHandle
handles.desc: handle indicating the source of the authorization value for the Attached Component or NV Alias

handles.name: ac
handles.desc: handle indicating the Attached Component to which the object will be sent

parameters.name: acDataIn
parameters.desc: Optional non sensitive information related to the object

parameters.name: acDataOut
parameters.desc: May include AC specific data or information about an error.

Policy_AC_SendSelect.name: TPM2_Policy_AC_SendSelect
Policy_AC_SendSelect.tag: TPM_ST_SESSIONS if an audit or decrypt session is present; otherwise, TPM_ST_NO_SESSIONS

handles.name: policySession
handles.desc: handle for the policy session being extended

parameters.name: objectName
parameters.desc: the Name of the Object to be sent

parameters.name: authHandleName
parameters.desc: the Name associated with *authHandle* used in the TPM2_AC_Send() command

parameters.name: acName
parameters.desc: the Name of the Attached Component to which the Object will be sent

parameters.name: includeObject
parameters.desc: if SET, *objectName* will be included in the value in *policySession*→  *policyDigest*

handles.name: actHandle
handles.desc: Handle of the selected ACT

parameters.name: startTimeout
parameters.desc: the start timeout value for the ACT in seconds
